newsitem.title: USA: Maine voters favor King's clear-cutting pact -poll.
newsitem.headline: Maine voters favor King's clear-cutting pact -poll.

text.p: A survey of likely Maine voters showed more support for the so-called forestry compact proposed by Gov. Angus King, which would limit the clearcutting of forests, than the other two options combined.

Strategic Marketing Survey showed that 46 percent of those polled said they will vote for governor's measure, which is on the Nov 5 ballot, along with competing proposals, including one plan to ban the practice entirely.
Of the voters who were surveyed, 22 percent were undecided on the issue when the poll was conducted.
